generif.text: Overexpression of RGS1 in progenitor pro-B cells (which have little endogenous RGS1) impairs CXCL12-induced focal adhesion kinase activation, chemotaxis, and adhesion to membrane domains.

BP.term: adenylate cyclase-inhibiting G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway

name: regulator of G protein signaling 1

wikipathways.name: Calcium Regulation in the Cardiac Cell

summary: This gene encodes a member of the regulator of G-protein signalling family. This protein is located on the cytosolic side of the plasma membrane and contains a conserved, 120 amino acid motif called the RGS domain. The protein attenuates the signalling activity of G-proteins by binding to activated, GTP-bound G alpha subunits and acting as a GTPase activating protein (GAP), increasing the rate of conversion of the GTP to GDP. This hydrolysis allows the G alpha subunits to bind G beta/gamma subunit heterodimers, forming inactive G-protein heterotrimers, thereby terminating the signal. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
